Process substitution: Yes (if system supports <tt>/dev/fd/''<n>''</tt> or named pipes)

Pipes: bytes (may contain serialized objects if <tt>print -C</tt> is used) concurrent

TCP/UDP connections as streams: Yes (client and server, but only TCP)

Subshells: partial (only under DR-DOS multitasker via COMMAND.COM /T)
partial (via %@EXECSTR[] and %@EXEC[], or via SET /M, ESET /M and UNSET /M and %@MASTER[…])

TCP/UDP connections as streams: yes (via FTP, TFTP, FTPS, SFTP, HTTP, HTTPS and IFTP, client only)
